title: Bride-to-be Lisa Faulkner celebrates with her besties on her hen do
text:
We can’t wait to see how hard they go for the wedding (Picture: Lisa Faulkner/Instagram)

Lisa Faulkner had the time of her life on her hen weekend as she partied with friends including Amanda Holden and Tamzin Outhwaite.

The 47-year-old celebrity chef brought together all her closes friends to celebrate getting married to MasterChef’s John Torode.

Their day-to-day meals must be lavish with two chefs in the house.

Uploading a picture of herself in a bathtub wearing a jewel-encrusted bride hat, she captioned it: ‘About last night… the beginning of the [hen emojis] starting with fizzy pop and my fabulous hat that I’m never taking off!!!’

She celebrated in the cosy setting of her Soho Farmhouse, and we can’t think of a better way to party than in a fancy cabin.

Lisa and her besties enjoyed top tier Japanese cuisine at Pen Yen restaurant.

We’re getting more envious by the minute.

The star was surrounded by her closest friends (Picture: @lisafaulknercooks/Instagram)

How do we join? (Picture: @lisafaulknercooks)

The actress uploaded two group pictures of everyone that attended the hen do, including one with everyone in their matching pyjamas and Lisa still wearing the hat.

Advertisement

Advertisement

She did warn us she’s never taking it off.

‘Thank you my lovely friends for giving me the best hen ever!!!’ she wrote. ‘I love you all and my heart is bursting with happiness @yoga_with_victoria @emma_dsouza @theangelagriffin @officiallulubw@officialnicstep @victoriapalin @noholdenback @glamzin I [love] you.’

John, 54, popped the question on Christmas Day in 2018, four years after the two met on Celebrity MasterChef.

The foodie revealed in March that his bride-to-be forgot to say ‘yes’ to his proposal for three whole hours.

Speaking to Good Morning Britain about his proposal, he said: ‘I did and she said “yes” which was really lovely.

Uh, how cute are these two? (Picture: ITV/ Matt Frost)

‘In fact, she didn’t yes for three and a half hours because she was so gobsmacked. I remember saying to her, “Are you going to say yes?” and she went, “Have I not said yes?” I went, “No you have not said yes yet”.’

Oh, Lisa.

Speaking to The Sun earlier this year, Lisa admitted the couple had to put a pause on their wedding due to their busy work schedules.

‘I’ve been so busy with writing and doing the show,’ she said. ‘Once I’ve got Easter out the way we can start planning.’
